title: Citi Wins 'Client Clearing Firm of the Year' Award
summary: London - Citi has won the 'Client Clearing Firm of The Year' award from Futures and Options World (FOW), the global derivatives publication. The FOW awards, which recognize the best and brightest in a range of categories from across the globe, are designed to identify excellence in the industry.
tag-1: Citi Wins 'Client Clearing Firm of the Year' Award
tag-2: London – Citi has won the 'Client Clearing Firm of The Year' award from Futures and Options World (FOW), the global derivatives publication. The FOW awards, which recognize the best and brightest in a range of categories from across the globe, are designed to identify excellence in the industry.
tag-3: At a time when many competitors have retrenched, Citi has continued to deploy industry-leading technology, focusing on delivering world class client service, while maintaining the highest standards of control and risk management.
tag-4: Technology investment remained a key focus for Citi in 2016, demonstrated by this year's launch of Fusion Clear, a proprietary, innovative, real time, post-trade matching and allocation engine, which reduces vendor dependencies and costs while delivering superior platform capabilities.
tag-5: Additionally, in 2016 Citi extended its popular margin "What-If" tool to futures, equipping clients with a ground-breaking way to better manage collateral requirements across futures and cleared swaps. Clients can now estimate margin requirements on all major clearinghouses and on more than 30 exchanges.
tag-6: Jerome Kemp, Global Head of Futures, Clearing and Collateral, said, "We are delighted to have received this prestigious award. 2016 was a year of significant, strategic client acquisition for Citi and we are very proud of our achievement as a top tier futures provider while further adding to our dominant position in global OTC clearing."
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
